column1: Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome is one of the most common causes of fast heart rate problems in infants and children.
Most people with Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome do not have any other heart problems.
Some people with Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome have only a few episodes of rapid heart rate.

A person with this syndrome may have: - Chest pain or chest tightness - Dizziness - Light-headedness - Fainting - Palpitations (a sensation of feeling your heart beating, usually quickly or irregularly) - Shortness of breath
